c74object.name: rdcblock~
c74object.digest: DC blocking filter with sample accurate reset
c74object.description: rdcblock~ is a simple dc blocking filter in which the filter memory can be reset on a sample-accurate basis, using a dedicated reset input. The original use was for use in granular applications where the DC varies according to the grain parameters. rdcblock~ is heavily based on dcblock~ from the PeRColate objects by Dan Trueman and R. Luke DuBois. (https://github.com/Cycling74/percolate/releases/tag/v1.0)

objarg.name: mode
objarg.description:
The first argument sets the mode of rdcblock~.
In mode 0 (default) the filter memory is totally zeroed on reset.
In mode 1 the output memory is zeroed, whilst the input memory is set to the value of the incoming sample.
Neither will instantly adapt to a new DC level, but mode 1 may be more effective in some cases (it gives ideal performance when there is no other input but the DC). Both modes outperform the situation in which the filter has no reset.

method.name: signal
method.description:
In the first inlet: A signal to be processed by the filter.
In the second inlet: A dedicated reset input. It takes a trigger signal to clear the filters memory.

entry.name: signal
entry.description: Outputs a DC blocked audio signal.
